Sequence Information.Peptide Name: 6K-1426 (Synthetic AMPs, Temporin-WY2 analog, Lys-rich, Leu-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: Designed based an amphibian derived template

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (80%) to6K-WY2Leu: 26%; K: 42%; A: 11%.Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidated.Activity: active against Gram+ bacteria S. aureus ATCC CRM 6538 or MRSA BAA 1707 or clinical MRSA B038 V1S1 A (MIC 8-16 uM), E. faecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 16 uM), Gram- E. coli NCTC 8739 or clinical BAA 2340 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 or PA14 or PAO1 (MIC 2-16 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 43816 (MIC 2 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:E. coli (4. 5 mM), NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli (6 uM), CaCl2-sensitive:E. coli (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM),  ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 mM), FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM). Salt-insensitive:E. coli. NaCl-insensitized:P. aeruginosa PA14 (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa PA14  (4. 5 mM), NH4Cl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa PA14  (6 uM), CaCl2-insensitive:P. aeruginosai PA14  (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:P. aeruginosa PA14 (1 mM),  ZnCl2-insensitive:P. aeruginosa PA14 (8 mM), FeCl3-insensitive:P. aeruginosa PA14 (4 uM). Salt-insensitive:P. aeruginosa PA14. However, it is sensitive to PAO1: NaCl-sensitized:P. aeruginosa PAO1 (150 mM), KCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa PAO1  (4. 5 mM), NH4Cl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa PAO1  (6 uM), CaCl2-sensitive:P. aeruginosai PAO1  (2.5 mM), MgCl2-sensitive:P. aeruginosa PAO1 (1 mM),  ZnCl2-sensitive:P. aeruginosa PAO1 (8 mM), FeCl3-sensitive:P. aeruginosa PAO1 (4 uM). Salt-sensitive:P. aeruginosa PAO1.  Human serum-insensitive:MRSA (%?).Biofilms: S. aureus: Inhibited formation (MBIC 4-8 uM). Disrupt preformed biofilms: E. coli (MBEC 32 uM).Structure:  random coils in NH4AC buffer and helical in 50% TFE.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: HC50=32 uM.
Literature Information.Author: Liao F, Ye Z, Cheng J, Zhu J, Chen X, Zhou X, Wang T, Jiang Y, Ma C, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Discovery and engineering of a novel peptide, Temporin-WY2, with enhanced in vitro and in vivo efficacy against multi-drug resistant bacteria
